before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"e3qae","text":"Buffer P1 must be activated with RNase A solution before use (one vial per one bottle) and store at 2-8 degrees celsius after activation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"20irf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"eih3r","text":"TIANprep Mini Plasmid Kit is based on alkaline lysis technology followed by adsorption of DNA onto silica membrane in the presence of high salt. Plasmid DNA purified with TIANprep Mini Plasmid Kit is immediately readyfor use. Phenol extraction and ethanol precipitation are not required. High quality plasmid DNA is eluted in a small volume of Tris Buffer or deionized water. This protocol is designed for purification of plasmid DNA from 1-5ml overnight cultures of E. coli in LB (Luria-Bertani) medium. Plasmid DNA prepared by TIANprep Mini Plasmid Kit is suitable for avariety of routine applications including restriction enzyme digestion, sequencing, library screening, ligation and trans-formation, in vitro translation, and transfection of robust cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9jorp","text":"Direct drainage of supernatant by opening and inverting the tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3o3fi","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ce58u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"result","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"aql43","text":"Bacteria pellet should be present in the microcentrifuge tube.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

Vortex and pipette can be used to help homogenize the mixture.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7ufih","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":6,"offset":2,"style":"bold"}],"key":"ale7t","text":"- DO NOT allow the lysis reaction to continue for more than ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2dcn6","text":"Add   of Buffer P3 and mix immediately by inverting the tube 6-8 times to neutralize Buffer P2.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":9,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7s2re","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8mlv0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a4c69","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2kd0m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"350","error":false,"guid":"705AA7A002F011EE932807EE96FBBED6","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"safety","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7spbq","text":"Avoid direct contact with Buffer P3","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"2":{"type":"result","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6ftgn","text":"There should be no white precipitation left in the supernatant. If there is, the mixture should be centrifuged again.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3eutu","text":"OPTIONAL: Wash the Spin Column CP3 by adding   of Buffer PD and centrifuge at   and discard the flow-through.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10},{"style":"bold","offset":50,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":45,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":78,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5il3a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"880cm","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b4gcu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"500","error":false,"guid":"EDDC19F002F211EE932807EE96FBBED6","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"12000","duration":60,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"FC75BDE002F211EE932807EE96FBBED6","id":0,"label":"table-top microcentrifuge","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":32,"unit":33}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":6,"offset":56,"style":"bold"},{"length":6,"offset":56,"style":"italic"}],"key":"8epk0","text":"Recommended to remove trace nuclease activity when using endA+ strains such as the JM series, HB101 and its derivatives, or any wild-type strain, which have high levels of nuclease activity or high carbohydrate content.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
